citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
A few instances of using a medication past its expiration/discard date have occurred. An anesthetic drug and its reversal
agent were administered to three separate macaques, on separate occasions, one to five days past the 28 days post
bottle puncture discard date. Additionally, one of the local anesthetic agents for a surgical procedure was used within a
week past its expiration date on four squirrel monkeys. Per the facility, all animals recovered without complications. Drugs
past the expiration or discard date may not be as effective or may be contaminated. Adequate pre-procedural and post-
procedural care in accordance with current established veterinary medical and nursing procedures are necessary for
adequate care of the animals.
Identified and corrected prior to inspection. Establish methods to maintain compliance from this date, 08/06/2025, forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
STEPHANIE MAYARD, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.33(b)(5) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
A few instances of using a medication past its expiration/discard date have occurred. An anesthetic drug and its reversal 
agent were administered to three separate macaques, on separate occasions, one to five days past the 28 days post 
bottle puncture discard date. Additionally, one of the local anesthetic agents for a surgical procedure was used within a 
week past its expiration date on four squirrel monkeys. Per the facility, all animals recovered without complications. Drugs 
past the expiration or discard date may not be as effective or may be contaminated. Adequate pre-procedural and post-
procedural care in accordance with current established veterinary medical and nursing procedures are necessary for 
adequate care of the animals. 
 
Identified and corrected prior to inspection. Establish methods to maintain compliance from this date, 08/06/2025, forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
STEPHANIE MAYARD, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
